titleStmt.title: Thomas J. Engle et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9127

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Hon Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky We would most respectfull submit to Honor Clemency that Owen Frances was fined $12.50 cents on a charge of a breach of the peace before John Parker a Justice of the peace for said county Which fine we ask your Honor. to remit as Mr Frances is a verry poor man with a large family of children all females and it would be verry oppressive upon him to pay. said fine Mr Frances is a good citizen and a verry respectable man but became excited and committed a breach of the peace but no damage was done
We the undersigned do know the foregoing facts to be true given under our hands this the 3rd day of July 1862

Thos J Engle Ck J. Co. & Ct. Court.
Isaac J Faubus P. J. J. C
Alfred Evans
Henry Faubus
P S If your Honor sees fit to remit this fine please send to Thos J. Engle McKee Jackson county Ky

Jackson J P Ct.
$12.50 } Breach
O Frances
Remission Issd July 22 1862
